venue.address_2: Large parking lot on right. past the Spring
venue.name: Salmon River State Forest

item.description:
What: Simple Walk & Picknick at Salmon River State Forest in Colchester CT

Today: A chance of showers and thunderstorms, mainly after 3pm. Some of the storms could produce heavy rain. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 78. Calm wind becoming south between 4 and 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

MIGHT NOT BE PERFECT..will make adjustments when it does rain

When: August 30, 2008 12:00 PM

Meetup Description: Hi Everyone,

The eulogy and the Spreading of the ashes in the river to symbolize the kayaks and trailer's last trip from river to to cove then river to ocean will be before the festivities start..


This event is also listed on my other sites..

This is a pretty good park for a simple walk and Barbie-q,
I will also have the fire pit and some other things depending on the weather for the day.

Bring Food and what ever else you like,

as always HIDE the bugg juice.. Be descrete...we are senior citizens and must keep our image up..

I have the grille, but there are charcoal grills there too.

The Comstock Covered Bridge is a short walk away to the north, other simple trails are in the area of the picknick tables too..
If its hot out, there is enough water in the river to place your butt in it..so bring a towel..

I listed this for Saturday, and have Sunday as the back up day if the weather isnt good.
Monday you can enjoy in peace..not listing anything for that day.

SUNDAY IS A BACKUP DAY..i will update on the weather or changes here on the site or via e amil...

I know most of you want to go to the Singlesevent event at the beach on Sunday..
I cant go, i dont have enough money for the trip and Hamandacid Beach entry fee.
So you have options for the weekend.

So im still coming here if Sunday is good..and saturday is cancelled.

Besides i want to explore this area.



Getting There:
For GPS use 1 Gulf Road, East Hampton, CT

From the Norwich area: take Route 2 west, Exit 18. Follow Route 16 west for 6.2 miles; turn left into the recreation area. = Gulf Road, Look for the Salmon River State Forst Sign, enter road, pass the flowing spring on left go to parking lot on right past the spring,
Look for 6 Foot orange Pole nd Yellow SLOW kids at play sign at one of the tables.



From the New London area: follow Route 11 north onto Route 2 west, Exit 18. Follow Route 16 west for 6.2 miles. Turn left into the recreation area.
= Gulf Road, Look for the Salmon River State Forst Sign, enter road, pass the flowing spring on left go to parking lot on right past the spring,
Look for 6 Foot orange Pole And Yellow SLOW kids at play sign at one of the tables

From the Middletown area: follow Route 66 east onto Route 16. Follow Route 16 east for 5.5 miles. Turn right into recreation area.
= Gulf Road, Look for the Salmon River State Forst Sign, enter road, pass the flowing spring on left go to parking lot on right past the spring,
Look for 6 Foot orange Pole And Yellow SLOW kids at play sign at one of the tables

From the Hartford area: take Route 2 east, Exit 16. Follow Route 149 south for 3.2 miles. Turn right onto Route 16 west. Follow Route 16 west for 1.9 miles. Turn left into the recreation area. = Gulf Road, Look for the Salmon River State Forst Sign, enter road, pass the flowing spring on left go to parking lot on right past the spring,
Look for 6 Foot orange Pole And Yellow SLOW kids at play sign at one of the tables.

= Gulf Road, Look for the Salmon River State Forst Sign, enter road, pass the flowing spring on left go to parking lot on right past the spring,
Look for 6 Foot orange Pole nd Yellow SLOW kids at play sign at one of the tables.

Learn more here:
http://friends.meetup...
item.how_to_find_us: LOOK FOR THE 6 foot tall ORANGE POLE AND SLOW ADULTS AT PLAY SIGN by The Table
